Key Match Events: Namibia played to a one all draw against Lesotho in a preparatory match on Saturday
Erastus Kalula scored the goal for Namibia on his national team debut
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Collin Benjamin upped the Warriors' tempo as the Senior Men's National team continued their preparations for the upcoming 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualifiers
Coach Benjamin says it has been a competitive camp in Johannesburg, with great display of skill and dedication from the players
Namibia will host Liberia on 5 June at the Orlando Stadium followed by their second encounter against Tunisia on 9 June 2024
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Benjamin says it was a good test to get the young players exposed to international football
Erastus Kalula says the intensity at national level is high and the games are very fast, but scoring on his debut was definitely a confidence booster
Miscellaneous Highlights: Namibia will host Liberia on 5 June at the Orlando Stadium followed by their second encounter against Tunisia on 9 June 2024
The Namibia Football Association (NFA) is the governing body of football in Namibia
Others: The Orlando Stadium will host the matches against Liberia and Tunisia
